Lesson 19 – Revision of All Tenses

Today, we will revise all tenses by making the same sentence in 18 different tenses. First, try translating the list yourself, then we will look at the complete answers in a table.

The sentence to use: I play cricket.

Here are the forms to translate:
1. I play cricket
2. I am playing cricket
3. I can play cricket
4. I would like to play cricket
5. I must play cricket
6. I will play cricket
7. I will be playing cricket
8. When do you play cricket?
9. Do you play cricket?
10. May I play cricket?
11. I wanted to play cricket
12. I had to play cricket
13. I played cricket
14. I was playing cricket
15. I have played cricket
16. I have been playing cricket
17. I had played cricket
18. I had been playing cricket

Answers – Cricket in 18 Tenses

S.No.GermanEnglish
1Ich spiele CricketI play cricket
2Ich spiele gerade CricketI am playing cricket
3Ich kann Cricket spielenI can play cricket
4Ich möchte Cricket spielenI would like to play cricket
5Ich muss Cricket spielenI must play cricket
6Ich werde Cricket spielenI will play cricket
7Ich werde Cricket spielenI will be playing cricket
8Wann spielst du Cricket?When do you play cricket?
9Spielst du Cricket?Do you play cricket?
10Darf ich Cricket spielen?May I play cricket?
11Ich wollte Cricket spielenI wanted to play cricket
12Ich musste Cricket spielenI had to play cricket
13Ich spielte CricketI played cricket
14Ich spielte CricketI was playing cricket
15Ich habe Cricket gespieltI have played cricket
16Ich habe Cricket gespieltI have been playing cricket
17Ich hatte Cricket gespieltI had played cricket
18Ich hatte Cricket gespieltI had been playing cricket

Summary

In this revision, we practiced all key German tenses with the same sentence for easier comparison. We saw how some tenses in English merge into the same form in German, such as continuous forms and perfect continuous tenses. Keep practicing these structures to strengthen your fluency!
